meanings.definition: A person who ignores or disregards something.
meanings.sent1: The ignorer pretended not to hear the teacher calling their name.
meanings.sent2: The new student in class was an ignorer of the school rules.
meanings.sent3: The ignorer of warnings ended up getting lost in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The little squirrel was an expert ignorer of the 'Do Not Feed the Animals' sign.
meanings.sent5: The ignorer of safety instructions regretted not wearing a helmet during the bike ride.

meanings.definition: To refuse to take notice of or acknowledge something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not ignorer the important message on the bulletin board.
meanings.sent2: She chose to ignorer the rude comments and walked away calmly.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to ignorer its owner's calls and continued napping.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs will only lead you into trouble, so do not ignorer them.
meanings.sent5: If you ignorer the traffic lights, you might cause an accident, so always pay attention.

meanings.definition: To treat with disregard or neglect.
meanings.sent1: It is not right to ignorer the needs of those who depend on you.
meanings.sent2: The manager warned the employee not to ignorer the company's policies.
meanings.sent3: The plant started to wither because the owner chose to ignorer its watering schedule.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been ignorering her health when she fell sick.
meanings.sent5: If you ignorer your responsibilities, they will only pile up and become harder to manage.
